entities.name: Fairytales
entities.description: Fairytales are a beloved form of storytelling that have captivated audiences for centuries with their magical elements and timeless themes. They often originate from oral traditions, folklore, and cultural myths.

attributes.Purpose: To entertain, inspire, and offer valuable insights into the human experience
attributes.Origin: Oral traditions, folklore, and cultural myths

entities.name: Brothers Grimm
entities.description: Jacob and Wilhelm Grimm, German brothers and scholars, are best known for collecting and publishing fairy tales in the early 19th century.

entities.name: Grimm"s Fairy Tales
entities.description: A collection of fairy tales compiled and published by the Brothers Grimm in the early 19th century, including classic stories such as "Cinderella," "Snow White," and "Hansel and Gretel."

entities.name: Cinderella
entities.description: Cinderella is the protagonist of a classic fairy tale that has been told in various forms across different cultures for centuries. The most familiar version today was published by Charles Perrault in 1697.

entities.name: Snow White
entities.description: Snow White is a beautiful princess who escapes her wicked stepmother, the evil queen, and finds refuge with seven dwarfs. She ultimately triumphs over the queen"s jealousy and finds her happily ever after with a handsome prince.

entities.name: Hansel and Gretel
entities.description: Hansel and Gretel are the protagonists of a classic fairytale that has captured the imaginations of readers for generations. They are known for their wit and bravery in outsmarting a witch and finding their way back home.

entities.name: German
entities.description: German refers to the culture and nationality associated with Germany, known for its rich history, folklore, and contributions to literature and science.

attributes.Folklore Traditions: Rich in oral traditions and fairytales

entities.name: peasants and villagers
entities.description: Peasants and villagers are rural inhabitants who lived in the German countryside during the time of the Brothers Grimm. They were often the source of oral traditions and stories that the brothers collected.

entities.name: various forms
entities.description: The concept of "various forms" refers to the different versions or adaptations of a story, particularly in the context of fairytales like Cinderella and Snow White. These forms can include variations across cultures, oral traditions, and written records.

attributes.Cultural Diversity: Includes German, Italian, and Slavic traditions
attributes.Transmission Method: Passed down verbally for generations before being recorded

entities.name: ancient Greece
entities.description: Ancient Greece was a civilization that developed from the period of the Greek Dark Ages (c. 1200–800 BC) to the end of antiquity (c. AD 600). It is known for its significant contributions to philosophy, literature, and mythology.

entities.name: Rhodopis
entities.description: Rhodopis was a young girl in ancient Greece whose story is considered one of the earliest versions of Cinderella. She marries the king after he finds her lost slipper.

entities.name: Charles Perrault
entities.description: Charles Perrault was a French author and member of the Académie française. He is best known for his fairy tales, which have become classic children"s literature.
The year 1697 was significant in the history of literature, particularly for the publication of fairy tales.

entities.name: fairy godmother
entities.description: A magical character who appears in various fairy tales, often to help the protagonist with their challenges.

attributes.Magical Abilities: Transform objects and people, grant wishes, provide magical items

entities.name: glass slipper
entities.description: A magical glass slipper that plays a central role in the fairy tale of Cinderella.

entities.name: stroke of midnight
entities.description: The stroke of midnight refers to the exact moment when the clock strikes twelve, marking the transition from one day to the next. In Perrault"s version of Cinderella, this event is significant as it triggers the transformation of the magical elements back to their original forms.

attributes.Significance in Literature: Marking the end of a magical period and the return to reality

entities.name: Slavic traditions
entities.description: Slavic traditions encompass the cultural practices, folklore, and oral traditions of Slavic peoples.

entities.name: wicked stepmother
entities.description: The wicked stepmother is an evil and malevolent character who appears in various fairy tales, often as the antagonist. In the story of Snow White, she forces Snow White to flee into the forest.

entities.name: seven dwarfs
entities.description: The seven dwarfs are characters from the fairy tale "Snow White." They help Snow White and protect her from the evil queen.

entities.name: the queen
entities.description: The queen, also known as the evil stepmother of Snow White, is a central antagonist in the story. She is characterized by her jealousy and malevolent actions.

entities.name: a handsome prince
entities.description: A character in fairy tales, often depicted as charming and heroic, who rescues the princess and lives happily ever after.

entities.name: parents
entities.description: The parents are characters in the story of "Hansel and Gretel," who, due to difficult circumstances, abandon their children in the woods.

entities.name: cannibalistic witch
entities.description: A malevolent character in fairy tales who lures children into her house made of sweets and intends to eat them.

entities.name: Hansel
entities.description: Hansel is one of the main characters in the classic fairytale "Hansel and Gretel." He, along with his sister Gretel, outsmarts a witch and finds their way back home.

entities.name: Gretel
entities.description: Gretel is a character from the classic fairytale "Hansel and Gretel," known for her wit and bravery in outsmarting the witch.

entities.name: the witch
entities.description: The witch is a malevolent figure in the story of Hansel and Gretel, known for her cunning and dangerous nature. She lives in a house made of sweets and lures children to eat it before attempting to cook them.

attributes.Residence: House made of sweets in the forest

entities.name: Beauty and the Beast
entities.description: A classic fairy tale about love and transformation, where a kind-hearted young woman sees beyond the beastly exterior of a cursed prince to discover his true nature.

entities.name: Ovid
entities.description: Ovid was a Roman poet known for his mythological and love poetry, including the Metamorphoses.

entities.name: Pygmalion and Galatea
entities.description: The myth of Pygmalion and Galatea is an ancient story from Roman mythology, where a sculptor named Pygmalion falls in love with his own creation, a statue that comes to life.

entities.name: sculptor
entities.description: A person who creates sculptures, often from materials such as stone, metal, or wood.

entities.name: statue
entities.description: A statue that comes to life in the story of a sculptor who falls in love with his creation.

entities.name: cursed prince
entities.description: The cursed prince is the main character in the tale of "Beauty and the Beast," where he has been transformed into a beast due to a curse. A kind-hearted young woman, Beauty, sees beyond his exterior and discovers his true nature.

entities.name: Wicked Stepmother (Evil Queen)
entities.description: The wicked stepmother of Snow White, known as the evil queen, is a powerful and jealous woman who seeks to eliminate Snow White.

entities.name: Seven Dwarfs
entities.description: The seven dwarfs are friendly and helpful characters who provide shelter and protection to Snow White.

entities.name: Handsome Prince
entities.description: The handsome prince is a noble and kind-hearted character who rescues Snow White and marries her.

entities.name: Witch
entities.description: A malevolent character who attempts to harm Hansel and Gretel but is outwitted by them.

entities.name: Home
entities.description: The place where Hansel and Gretel live with their family.

entities.name: Oral Traditions
entities.description: Oral traditions are cultural practices of passing down stories, legends, and knowledge through spoken word from one generation to another.

entities.name: German Countryside
entities.description: The German countryside refers to the rural areas of Germany, characterized by agricultural landscapes and small villages.

entities.name: King of Egypt
entities.description: The King of Egypt is a historical and mythological figure who ruled over ancient Egypt.

entities.name: Cinderella (by Charles Perrault)
entities.description: A classic fairy tale about a young girl who, with the help of her fairy godmother, attends a royal ball and eventually marries the prince.

entities.name: Cinderella"s Magical Elements
entities.description: In Perrault"s version of Cinderella, these elements include the fairy godmother"s transformations such as the glass slipper and the carriage.

entities.name: Cinderella (Perrault"s Version)
entities.description: A classic fairy tale where a young girl, Cinderella, is helped by her fairy godmother to attend the royal ball and eventually marries the prince.

entities.name: evil queen
entities.description: The evil queen is a malevolent character who appears in various fairy tales, often as the antagonist. In the story of Snow White, she is the wicked stepmother.

entities.name: Evil Queen
entities.description: The Evil Queen is the antagonist of the fairy tale "Snow White." She is jealous of Snow White"s beauty and tries to kill her.

entities.name: Snow White"s Beauty
entities.description: Snow White is described as a beautiful princess.

entities.name: Brothers Grimm Collection
entities.description: A collection of fairy tales compiled by the Brothers Grimm, which includes many classic stories.

entities.name: Curse
entities.description: A curse is a magical spell that causes harm or misfortune to the person it is cast upon. In this case, the curse transformed the prince into a beast.

entities.name: Beauty
entities.description: Beauty is a kind-hearted young woman who sees beyond the beastly exterior of the cursed prince and discovers his true nature.
